page.title: 05PRIMARY EDUCATION
page.content: There are 7{primary schools}in the area - Lasswade, Bonnyrigg, Hopefield, Hawthornden, Loanhead, St.Mary's (Bonnyrigg) and St.Margaret's Primary (Loanhead). The latter two cater especially for{Roman Catholic}pupils. The largest of the area's primary schools is Lasswade Primary with a roll of 428 pupils and 18 teaching staff; the smallest, St.Margaret's with 97 pupils and 5 teaching staff. Three of these schools, Lasswade, Bonnyrigg and Hopefield have been built in the past ten years and are modern open-plan buildings. Hawthornden and St.Margaret's are fairly new buildings while Bonnyrigg, St.Mary's and Loanhead Primaries were built at the turn of the century and are traditional stone built buildings with large classrooms.
